name: Overview
main:
In 2014, Islamic State (IS) took over significant portions of Iraqi territory, triggering mass displacement and severe humanitarian needs. After a military stalemate throughout much of 2015, government operations to retake territory from IS were stepped up in 2016 and are ongoing in 2017, aggravating displacement and humanitarian needs, particularly in Anbar and Mosul corridors.? Access constraints and human rights violations from all warring parties are of major concern.

Iraq now hosts three million IDPs, one of the largest internally displaced populations in the world.? IDPs and Syrian refugees make up 25% of the population in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KR-I).?

INFORM measures Iraq’s risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be very high, at 6.9/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity are of particular concern, at 7.7/10 and 7/10 rates.?
latest_developments_past:
08/04: Between 27 March and 8 April, 300 new trauma cases were referred and treated in five hospitals in west Mosul. In total, over 1,861 trauma cases have been referred to facilities since 18 February. Of these, 73% of trauma cases referred to facilities are civilians.?

05/04: Suspected IS militants launched a series of attacks in Tikrit, Salah ad-Din, which resulted in at least 42 people wounded, and 31 deaths.?
